intro: Hieracium auriculiforme subsp. holubyanum, commonly known as the Holubyan’s hawkweed, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to Central and Eastern Europe. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, characterized by its composite flower heads and opposite leaf arrangement. The plant typically grows in open, sunny habitats such as meadows and grasslands. Its leaves are broadly lanceolate with hairy surfaces, and the flowers are yellow, forming a flat-topped inflorescence. It is often found in disturbed soils and can be invasive in certain regions.
